text: Jef Geeraerts (Jozef Adriaan Anna Geeraerts, 23 February 1930 - 11 May 2015) was a Belgian writer. He was born in Antwerp. He decided to become a writer. He went to the University of Brussels to study Germanic languages. He was known for his books Gangreen 1 (Black Venus), Gangreen 2 (De Goede Moordenaar), Gangreen 3 (Het Teken van de Hond) and Gangreen 4 (Het Zevende Zegel). Geeraerts died of a heart attack in Ghent at the age of 85. ==Other websites== * Jef Geeraerts Category:1930 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Belgian novelists Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Writers from Antwerp
title: Jef Geeraerts
